title: Ayda Field admits she wants baby number four with Robbie Williams
text:
Ayda was honest about her desire for another child (Picture: Getty/Itv)

Ayda Field is keeping her fingers crossed for baby number four with Robbie Williams – 14 months after having a baby daughter.

Robbie and Ayda secretly welcomed daughter Coco via surrogate last year, announcing the news amid their stint on the X Factor judges table.

Coco has two older siblings, seven-year-old Teddy and Charlie, five – and now Ayda admits she is thinking of another.

Speaking on Loose Women, Ayda says she finds motherhood her ‘greatest pleasure’ and when she asked for more, she said: ‘I’d like to [but] you never know what’s going to happen in the world.

‘Will it work, will it not? Where we are in our life?’

She then added that while she was up for baby number four, singer Robbie isn’t as convinced as she is.

‘I’d like one more but after that I think Rob would commit me somewhere and run away with Gary Barlow into the sunset!’ she laughed.

In the meantime, Ayda said that Coco is getting plenty of attention from her older siblings, with the age gap meaning they think less of her as a threat and more a toy to play with.

‘The difference is because Teddy and Charlie were so close in age, they didn’t dote on each other, they were more jealous,’ the star said. ‘Whereas with Coco they want to feed her and play with her and show her things, she’s a living doll for them.

‘Sometimes I have to remind them she’s my child and I’m in charge but they’re the best siblings but I think Coco will want a teammate to rally against her brother and sister, but they’re such an amazing unit.’

Loose Women airs weekdays at 12.30pm on ITV.
